summary:
I am a Biopharmaceutical Scientist with an MSc in Biopharmaceutical Development from the University of Leeds and a strong interest in biopharmaceuticals and advanced therapies, particularly in the oncology and rare diseases field. 
I am currently working as a Study Director for Anapharm´s (CRO) Large Molecule department and I have previously worked as a Validation Scientist for a global CRO both lab- and office-based as well as an intern during my MSc. During my placement year, I conducted a research project focusing on the development of a method to identify anti-drug antibodies (ADA) in human whole blood using microsampling techniques. 
As part of a CRO, strong scientific and regulatory strategies are required, working within current GxP requirements and global regulatory (AEMPS, FDA, EMA, MHRA and ICH within others) guidelines.
I am a registered pharmacist in Spain holding a qualification from Universidad Complutense de Madrid and I am interested in both industry and clinical research, particularly keen on scientific communications. I am an enthusiastic and motivated pharmaceutical industry professional with strong and integrated knowledge and practical understanding of the drug development process as applied to biopharmaceuticals.

message.text:
Yesterday was my last day at Labcorp after (just under) 3 years working for the Immunochemistry department in Harrogate and though I am still processing my emotions, I wanted to thank everyone I have worked with over this time. 
I started in IChem as an MSc intern with little to no clue of what I had ahead and, even though beginnings are hard (even harder if they are in the middle of a pandemic), everybody took care of me and showed me the true essence of the department. I learnt a lot during that year, both in personal and professional areas, and it made me realise how much I loved the job I was doing and the people I was doing it with, hence why I never hesitated, not even once, when I was offered a position to stay as a full-time employee.
My second year was particularly challenging, but I was surrounded by amazing people who believed in me and ensured no challenge was too big for us. I am also very happy to say that during this year I saw some of my colleagues achieve their goals and I am grateful to say that now I can also call them my friends and, in a way, my family here in the UK.
My last year has definitely been a rollercoaster filled with new beginnings, projects and even a mentorship to a wonderful mentee.
Yesterday made me appreciate all I have been surrounded by over these past three years even more than I already did before. People coming to say bye, to chat, to hug me... It meant a lot to me and I will always look back and be grateful for the happy memories.
Thank you, everyone, for the time, the patience, the trust, the opportunities, the friendships... I will deeply miss you all. ❤️

commentary.text: Paula Amo ViagelMil gracias, Paula! A por todas! 🫶🏼
Elena Fauste Alonso, PhD Gracias, amiga 🫶🏼
So proud of you! Massive congratulations and best of luck 🩷
Best of luck! Enjoy the experience as much as you can! 🫶🏼
